remarks: Definition of a natural transformation between two functors.  A natural transformation ` A : F --> G ` is a collection of arrows ` A ( x ) : F ( x ) --> G ( x ) ` , such that ` A ( y ) o. F ( h ) = G ( h ) o. A ( x ) ` for each morphism ` h : x --> y ` .  Definition 6.1 in [Adamek] p. 83, and definition in [Lang] p. 65.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2017.)
